page.title: 03LIMERIGG CROFTING 2
page.content: In her garden Mrs Kay grows turnips, carrots,cabbages and other vegetables which are for her own use. The croft dates back to 1728 and originally the roof would have been thatched. When built,it was called "The Wee Black Loch" but it is not known exactly when the name was changed. The croft is of linear shape. The first room is used as a store room. Next is the barn where the young calves are kept. Through a door is a multi-purpose room,ie living room,bedroom and also where the meals are cooked in pots which are suspended from the"swee"and hang above a very large coal fire. There is another bedroom next door. The croft has a supply of cold water but there is no running hot water or plumbed in toilet. Mrs Kay,now in her eighties keeps remarkably good health.
